name: anthrone
Reason: 1,2-thiadiazole ring introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +70°C. The anthrone base itself has a melting point around 100°C due to the presence of a piperidine ring and a benzene ring. The piperidine ring introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +30°C. The benzene ring introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +20°C.
